title: Record profit at housebuilder Barratt
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Sep 9, 2015, 16:30 BST - UK Markets closed Record profit at housebuilder Barratt By Julia Bradshaw | Telegraph – 7 hours ago UBGXF 0.00 
A strong property market, buoyed by favourable mortgage lending, has boosted the UK's third-largest builder of residential property 
A surge in housing completions combined with higher selling prices has led to record results for homebuilder Barratt Developments (LSE: BDEV.L - news ) . 
The UK's third-largest housebuilder by market value reported a 45pc jump in pre-tax profits to £565.5m in the year to June 30 - the biggest profit the group has ever achieved. 
Completion volumes jumped 11pc to 16,447 - the highest for seven years - as demand continued to rise and Barratt managed to overcome labour shortages in the home construction market. 
Average private selling prices rose 9pc to £262,500, driven by a combination of the type of house sold and house price inflation. 
A key performance measure for Barratt is its return capital employed (ROCE), which is a ratio that shows how well and how efficiently it uses both its equity and debt to generate a return. A higher return indicates more efficient use of capital. 
Here, Barratt is doing well: ROCE rose to 23.9pc from 19.5pc last year. 
The construction firm maintained its owned and controlled land bank supply at 70,523 plots, equating to four-and-a-half years of production, with 16,956 plots approved for purchase during the year. 
The housebuilder made a strong start to the new financial year, too, with net private reservations up 15pc to 257 a week compared with the same time last year. 
Forward sales, including joint ventures, are running 32pc ahead. 
Chief executive David Thomas said: "The strong operational and financial performance reinforces the progress we have made over the past few years. 
"The new financial year has started very well. We have a strong forward sales position and are making very good progress towards our 2017 targets of at least a 20pc gross margin and at least a 25pc return on capital employed." 
John Allan, chairman of Barratt, said: "The market for new homes remains strong across Britain, with demand continuing to exceed supply. The mortgage market has continued to improve both in terms of availability and rates, as well as Government support for the new-build market. 
"Against this strong market backdrop we are delivering ongoing improvements in our own performance across all aspects of our operations (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) ."
